Above it stood the senate, which is constantly referred to in our authors as the working machinery of government, through which all questions of foreign policy must pass, as well as all the business of legislation. It was a numerous body, with settled aims and definite tra· ditions, with probably a lengthy, if not a lifelong tenure of their office.
